data.title: Fact check: 1999 'Omikron' video game has no connection to pandemic, Bill Gates
data.meta_description: Omikron: The Nomad Soul is a video game created by Quantic Dream in 1999. It has no connection to Bill Gates or the COVID-19 pandemic.
data.text:
The claim: Bill Gates created a video game called 'Omicron' in 1999

Social media users are linking a video game to Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates and the omicron coronavirus variant, playing into debunked conspiracy theories that Gates planned and engineered the COVID-19 pandemic or is implementing microchips through the vaccines.

"'Omicron' was the name of a 1999 video game by Microsoft – Bill Gates – about demons pretending to be humans and harvesting their souls" reads the text on an image posted to Facebook on Dec. 13.

The post accumulated more than 1,200 interactions within two days. Twitter users also shared the claim, and similar versions spread on TikTok.

One Facebook commenter wrote, "Seriously?! Wow....just a coincidence tho."

But it's not true. The video game – spelled with the letter "k" instead of "c" – was built by a French game developer. It has no connection to Microsoft.

Special access for subscribers! Click here to sign up for our fact-check text chat

USA TODAY reached out to the user who shared the Dec. 13 post for comment.

Game developed by French company

The video game, "Omikron: The Nomad Soul," was created by Quantic Dream and published by Eidos Interactive.

On Nov. 2, 1999, Quantic Dream, founded in Paris by David Cage, released the game on the Microsoft Windows platform, but it was not developed by either Gates or Microsoft. In 2000, it was released on the Dreamcast game console.

The game is set in a futuristic city called Omikron, in an alternate dimension. Players engage in combat to prevent their characters' souls from being captured by demons.

Fact check: 1963 movie did not predict the 'Omicron Variant'

Since May the World Health Organization has been using Greek letters to name coronavirus variants to make it easier for nonscientific communities. The word "omicron" is the 15th letter of the Greek alphabet. Some of the other variants include alpha, beta and delta.

Our rating: False

Based on our research, we rate FALSE the claim that Gates created a video game called “Omicron” in 1999. The video game, "Omikron: The Nomad Soul," was created by Quantic Dream, a French developer, and published by Eidos Interactive.
